CatDescriptText: Mrs. Indiana James, 124 W. 13th St., Homestead, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 14, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think the recreational facilities for young people in Pittsburgh are adequate? If not, what do you think should be done about it?" answer reads: "I cannot talk about Pittsburgh, but I say there are inadequate facilities in Homestead.  neighborhoods should do something to provide the needed facilities."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mrs. Indiana James wearing boucle coat with three buttons, light colored patterned head scarf, and eyeglasses, posed in front of block building
